skill.name: biopython
skill.description: Primary Python toolkit for molecular biology. Preferred for Python-based PubMed/NCBI queries (Bio.Entrez), sequence manipulation, file parsing (FASTA, GenBank, FASTQ, PDB), advanced BLAST workflows, structures, phylogenetics. For quick BLAST, use gget. For direct REST API, use pubmed-database.
skill.summary: Primary Python toolkit for molecular biology. Preferred for Python-based PubMed/NCBI queries (Bio.En...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns were found. The content is documentation and examples for Biopython usage without hidden network calls or obfuscation.

content.user_title: Analyze biology data with Biopython workflows
content.value_statement: Bioinformatics tasks can be slow without clear patterns and modules. This skill gives focused Biopython guidance for sequences, databases, structures, and phylogenetics.
actual_capabilities: Parse and write FASTA, GenBank, and FASTQ files with SeqIO
Run Entrez searches and fetch records from NCBI databases
Execute and parse BLAST searches and XML results
Perform pairwise and multiple sequence alignments with Bio.Align and AlignIO
Parse PDB and mmCIF structures and compute distances or RMSD
Build and manipulate phylogenetic trees from alignments
limitations: Requires Biopython and Python 3 to run code examples
Some workflows need external tools such as DSSP or local BLAST
NCBI access requires an email and follows rate limits
Does not supply datasets or validate biological interpretations

use_cases.title: Convert and filter sequences
use_cases.description: Parse large FASTA or GenBank files, filter records, and export clean subsets.

use_cases.title: Query NCBI for papers
use_cases.description: Search PubMed or GenBank with Entrez and fetch records for a project.

use_cases.title: Inspect protein structures
use_cases.description: Load PDB files, measure distances, and extract chain sequences.

prompt_templates.title: Parse FASTA
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to read a FASTA file with SeqIO and print each record id and length.

prompt_templates.title: NCBI search
prompt_templates.prompt: Give a Biopython example to search PubMed for CRISPR and list the first five PMIDs.

prompt_templates.title: BLAST workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide steps to run a BLASTN query and list top hit titles with E-values.

prompt_templates.title: Phylo pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a pipeline to read an aligned FASTA, compute distances, and build a neighbor-joining tree.

output_examples.input: Summarize the steps to fetch a GenBank record and compute GC content
output: Set your Entrez email for NCBI access
Fetch the GenBank record by accession
Compute GC content from the sequence

best_practices: Set Entrez email and respect NCBI rate limits
Use iterators for large files to control memory
anti_patterns: Calling Entrez without setting a valid email
Loading very large files fully into memory
Parsing files with the wrong format string

faq.question: Is this compatible with the latest Biopython?
faq.answer: Yes, it references Biopython 1.85 features and Python 3 usage.

faq.question: What limits should I expect with NCBI access?
faq.answer: NCBI enforces rate limits and may require an API key for higher throughput.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, the examples use standard Biopython modules that fit typical Python workflows.

faq.question: Does it access or store my private data?
faq.answer: No, it only describes Biopython usage and does not collect data.

faq.question: What if a parser throws format errors?
faq.answer: Verify the file format and ensure you are using the correct parser string.

faq.question: How is this different from gget or REST calls?
faq.answer: This focuses on Biopython library workflows, while gget and REST tools are separate approaches.
